title: eth_getLogs rejecting integer parameters
body:
### Description
The RPC call `eth_getLogs` should accept integer values for parameter `fromBlock` (and `toBlock`) as defined here: https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#eth_getlogs

`eth_getLogs` currently returns "Invalid Params" using both ws and http with fromBlock as integer. Casting the integer value to string returns the logs as expected.

I came across this issue when web3.js [automatically retrieved past events](https://github.com/ethereum/web3.js/blob/bd37b9171889c2c2d9789134598f3d1777a92560/packages/web3-core-subscriptions/src/subscription.js#L241) on event subscription creation with a given (integer) fromBlock.

### Acceptance Criteria
* `eth_getLogs` accepts integer type parameters where appropriate.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
WebSockets using [wscat](https://github.com/websockets/wscat):
```
miguel@Miguels-MBP ~ % npx wscat --connect localhost:8546
npx: installed 11 in 0.852s
Connected (press CTRL+C to quit)
> {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":220,"method":"eth_getLogs","params":[{"address":"0xaa8194af7c69df638a5ea7e82c4421b49223c821","topics":[],"fromBlock":1168}]}
< {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":220,"error":{"code":-32602,"message":"Invalid params"}}
> {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":220,"method":"eth_getLogs","params":[{"address":"0xaa8194af7c69df638a5ea7e82c4421b49223c821","topics":[],"fromBlock":"1168"}]}
< {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":220,"result":[{"logIndex":"0x0","removed":false,"blockNumber":"0x1c1d3","blockHash":"0xbfd6b14ed90eb206b3b7bdc8fa49a3695148861b06e0c5b97631466 ...
```
Using the Postman collection gives the same results on HTTP: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/Reference/API-Methods/

**Expected behavior:**
Logs (or empty array) to be returned.

**Actual behavior:**
Error response:
```
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":220,"error":{"code":-32602,"message":"Invalid params"}}
```
Relevant logs on DEBUG level:
```
2020-06-16 12:47:30.941+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-0 | DEBUG | WebSocketService | Received Websocket request {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":220,"method":"eth_getLogs","params":[{"address":"0xaa8194af7c69df638a5ea7e82c4421b49223c821","topics":[],"fromBlock":1168}]} (host=10.24.0.22, port=59958)
2020-06-16 12:47:30.941+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-13 | DEBUG | WebSocketRequestHandler | WS-RPC request -> eth_unsubscribe
2020-06-16 12:47:30.941+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-7 | DEBUG | SubscriptionManager | Subscribe request SubscribeRequest{subscriptionType=LOGS, includeTransaction=null, filterParameter=FilterParameter{fromBlock=BlockParameter{type=LATEST, number=OptionalLong.empty}, toBlock=BlockParameter{type=LATEST, number=OptionalLong.empty}, addresses=[0x9e9ae90b6cd198de531a8ddf5edbefb57af96c57], topics=[], blockHash=Optional.empty}, connectionId=__vertx.ws.d3415f5d-fc0a-4ef9-8b94-ee8b285ef3a6}

2020-06-16 12:47:30.941+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-5 | DEBUG | WebSocketRequestHandler | WS-RPC request -> eth_subscribe
2020-06-16 12:47:30.941+00:00 | vert.x-worker-thread-5 | DEBUG | SubscriptionManager | Subscribe request SubscribeRequest{subscriptionType=LOGS, includeTransaction=null, filterParameter=FilterParameter{fromBlock=BlockParameter{type=LATEST, number=OptionalLong.empty}, toBlock=BlockParameter{type=LATEST, number=OptionalLong.empty}, addresses=[0xaa8194af7c69df638a5ea7e82c4421b49223c821], topics=[], blockHash=Optional.empty}, connectionId=__vertx.ws.d3415f5d-fc0a-4ef9-8b94-ee8b285ef3a6}

Caused by: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.MismatchedInputException: Cannot construct instance of `org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.internal.parameters.BlockParameter` (although at least one Creator exists): no int/Int-argument constructor/factory method to deserialize from Number value (1168)
 at [Source: (String)"{"address":"0xaa8194af7c69df638a5ea7e82c4421b49223c821","topics":[],"fromBlock":1168}"; line: 1, column: 81] (through reference chain: org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.api.jsonrpc.internal.parameters.FilterParameter["fromBlock"])

```

**Frequency:**
100%

### Versions
* Software version:
```
besu/v1.4.5/linux-x86_64/oracle_openjdk-java-11
```
* Java version:
```
openjdk version "11.0.2" 2019-01-15
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.2+9-Debian-3bpo91)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 11.0.2+9-Debian-3bpo91, mixed mode, sharing)
```
* OS Name & Version:
```
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 9 (stretch)"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="9"
VERSION="9 (stretch)"
ID=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"
```
* Kernel Version:
```Linux blockchain-6df777585c-rwjq5 4.19.107 #1 SMP Thu May 28 15:07:17 PDT 2020 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

```
hyperkit: 0.20200224
minikube: v1.11.0
kubernetes v1.18.3
```
* Docker Version:
```
Client: Docker Engine - Community
 Version:           19.03.8

  Version:          0.18.0

```

### Additional Information

Haven't encountered this on other Ethereum clients.
Unless I'm reading the spec wrong, I believe you need to use numerals formatted as hex `Quantity`s. `0x` prefixed.

Hi @RatanRSur, thanks for the quick reply! Just read the part you mentioned ðŸ˜… : https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#hex-value-encoding

This seems like something that's usually formatted by web3.js, but isn't happening in this case. Will have a closer look at their implementation to see what's going on.
No problem :) Closing for now, feel free to reopen if it's something deeper than that.
